item.title: Nestle Buys Galderma For €3.1bn
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Nestlé and L'Oréal have approved by unanimous decision a strategic transaction for both companies under which L'Oréal will buy 48.5 million of its own shares (8% of its share capital) from Nestlé. The buyback will be partly financed through the disposal by L'Oréal to Nestlé of its 50% stake in Swiss dermatology pharmaceuticals company Galderma for an enterprise value of 3.1 billion euros (2.6 billion euros of equity value), paid by Nestlé in L'Oréal shares (21.2 million shares)
Deal Terms
For the remainder of the transaction, corresponding to 27.3 million L'Oréal shares held by Nestlé, payment will be in cash for an amount of 3.4 billion euros
Following the transaction, Nestlé's stake in L'Oréal will be reduced from 29.4% to 23.29% of the share capital and the Bettencourt Meyers family's stake in L'Oréal will increase from 30.6% to 33.31%.
The transaction will be accretive by more than 5% on L'Oréal's recurring earnings per share on a full year basis. The buyback will be exclusively financed with L'Oréal's available cash and through the issuance of commercial paper. It will not require the disposal of Sanofi shares held by L'Oréal.
The transaction is subject to customary conditions, including the prior consultation of Galderma's and L'Oréal's works councils and the clearance of relevant antitrust authorities. It is expected to close before the end of the first semester of 2014.
Implications For Galderma
Commenting on the transcation Mr. Peter Brabeck-Lemathe, Chairman of Nestlé, said:
"With this proposed acquisition of 50% of Galderma, Nestlé will pursue its strategic development in Nutrition, Health, and Wellness, by expanding its activities to medical skin treatments.
In this respect, Nestlé will create a new centre of activities in this area, through a new entity: Nestlé Skin Health SA. Galderma will be the foundation of this entity which will be run by Galderma's management.
As a wholly owned subsidiary of Nestlé, Galderma will have all the required means for its development which will benefit to the company, its employees as well as all other stakeholders.

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Alternative To Recent PhIII HCC Failures - What Does The Future Hold - ASCO GU Presentation
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: As HCC continues to evade best efforts to improve the overall treatment paradigm Andrew Zhu delivered at ASCO GU an impressive overview of ongoing developments in this therapy area.
There are essentially two trials with Bayer's sorafenib that have set the standard from a the perspective of future clinical trial development in HCC, the SHARP trial and the Asia-Pacific study (see below).
Follwing sorafenib's success, there has been renewed focus on drug development in HCC but there have also been a number of high-profile phIII failures. None have demonstrated improved survival or non-inferiority to sorafenib
Dr Zhu noted that EGFR inhibitors are not effective in this disease and whilst there is continuinig development of old targets such as VEGF VEGFr inhbitors, increasingly other agents are being evaluated that target intracellular mechanisms. The success of these agents will rely on the precise molecular signature of the tumours and also if these signatures predict the oncogene addiction of these tumours to the agent. The redudancy of the pathway has the potential to limit single agent efficacy in many instances.
Most patients with underlying cirrhosis have signifcant inflammation and there are ongoing efforts to target this inflammation. Additionally. stromal and cancer metabolism may represent alternative viable strategies.
Ongoing efforts with antianangiogenic agents in HCC are shown below. PhIII evaluation of Lilly's ramucirumab is currently ongoing, whilst a phIII study with Esai's levantinib has just been initiated. Levantinib demonstrated good phII single arm efficacy. Combination therapies are also being explored.
.
Earely signs of efficacy have been shown with CC-223 but additional clinical data is needed to validate its profile
Dr Zhu noted that immune based therapy has gained recent success in melanoma and that there is a need to critically re assess the importance of various molecules andd cell populations in HCC Most excitement at the moment is centred on inhibitors targeting the checkpoint pathway with early clinical trials entering the field.
The first reported study with tremilimumab has demonstrated some early signs of efficacy registering a modest response rate of 17% and PFS of approx of 6 months. Of interest was that the drug was also shown to modulated viral load. PDL-1 inhibitors are also entering clinical trials for HCC
A concept increasingly recognised within the field is that targeted therapy & chemo are unlikely to erradicated the cancer stem cell population. Agents targeting this filed are now under development with two clinical trials now under development employing this strategy.
Dr Zhu stated that technology is now available for genomic guided therapy to be increasingly integrated into treatment regimens. He cited other tumour types where we have actually achieved succesful examples of targeting the oncogene acddiction and noted that the list is getting longer and longer and highlighted several such approaches that are underway.
A recently concluded trial of tivantinib in 2nd line HCC and in an enriched population demonstrated a median survival of 7.2mnths vs 3.8 mnths in the placebo population. The unanswered question is whether the benefit was derived from from c-met inhibition or through cytotoxicity.
Lastly he focused on where do we stand right now in terms of the status of phIII HCC trials. Dr Zhu noted that the Y90 radioembolisation (trial ongoing in Signapore) approach is very appealing recognising the aggressivce of HCC invasion.

item.title: Eisai Thyroid Cancer Drug Meets PhIII Endpoint
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Eisai recently announced that its Phase III SELECT trial (Study 303) of lenvatinib, an investigational selective tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) showed a highly statistically significant improvement in progression free survival (PFS) in patients with radioiodine-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer (RR-DTC). A global PhIII in HCC is also underway
Study Design

The SELECT Study of (E7080) LEnvatinib in differentiated Cancer of the Thyroid) study was a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled Phase III study to compare the PFS of patients with RR-DTC and radiographic evidence of disease progression within the prior 12 months, treated with once-daily, oral lenvatinib (24 mg) versus placebo.

Secondary endpoints of the study included overall response rate (ORR), overall survival (OS) and safety. The study enrolled 392 patients at over 100 sites in Europe, North and South America and Asia and was conducted by Eisai in collaboration with the SFJ Pharmaceuticals Group.

The preliminary safety analysis showed that the five most common adverse reactions were hypertension, diarrhea, decreased appetite, decreased weight and nausea.

Next Steps

Based on these clinical results, Eisai will submit marketing authorization applications for lenvatinib to health authorities in Japan, the United States and Europe. If approved, lenvatinib will be the first molecular-targeted small molecule agent developed by a Japanese pharmaceutical company.

Thyroid Cancer Incidence/Unmet Need

Thyroid cancer is the most common endocrine malignancy and global figures show that its incidence has significantly increased over the last 50 years. RR-DTC, a life-threatening form of the disease, has a significant unmet treatment need.

Other Development Programmes for lenvatinib

Eisai has also initiated a global Phase III trial of lenvatinib in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and is conducting Phase II studies of lenvatinib in several other tumor types.

item.title: Targacept Completes Enrolment in Ph2b iOAB Study
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment:- Targacept, Inc, a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company developing novel NNR Therapeutics today announced it has completed recruitment of patients in its Phase 2b clinical study of TC-5214 as a treatment for overactive bladder (OAB). The company expects to report top-line results from the study in mid-2014.
TC5214's MOA
TC-5214 acts potently on alpha3beta4 and other neuronal nicotinic receptors (NNRs) located in or around the bladder that are believed to play a key role in bladder contraction and signaling of the urge to urinate
Nature of the study
The ongoing Phase 2b study is a double blind, placebo controlled, randomized, parallel group study being conducted at sites in the United States. The study's co-primary endpoints are change in micturition frequency per 24 hours and change in urinary incontinence episodes per 24 hours, in each case from baseline to 12 weeks.
The study is designed to randomize approximately 750 patients and includes a 3- or 5-week screening period followed by a 12-week treatment period during which patients receive either one of three doses of TC-5214 (0.5mg, 1mg or 2mg) or placebo twice daily, randomized in a ratio of 2:1:1:1 (placebo, low dose, mid dose, high dose), with a 2-week follow-up period.
Source: www.targacept.com

item.title: ZYTIGA® Reimbursed in Quebec for Pre-Chemo Setting
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Effective February 3, 2014, the province has added ZYTIGA® (abiraterone acetate) to the public drug formulary for the treatment of mCRPC in men who are asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic after failure of androgen deprivation therapy (ADT). Quebec joins British Columbia as the second province to add ZYTIGA® to its public formulary.
July 2011 - ZYTIGA® was approved by Health Canada for the treatment of men with mCRPC who had received prior chemotherapy containing docetaxel after failure of ADT.
May 2013 - Health Canada approved ZYTIGA® for the treatment of men with mCRPC who are asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic after failure of ADT.
Source: http://www.ramq.gouv.qc.ca/en/publications/citizens/legal-publications/Pages/list-medications.aspx

item.title: Key Messages from AstraZeneca Q4 and FY 2013 Results
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: FY13 revenue was $m25,711 (-6% at CER vs FY12). Revenue from key growth platforms were more than offset by the impact of patent expiries. Management reported that 2014 will be a challenging year for AstraZeneca, with generic competition emerging for Nexium. On the product side, Zoladex sales were $m247 (-9% vs Q4:12), and $m996 (-9% vs FY12). An update of the restructuring progam started last year is provided below.
In March 2013 the Company described how transforming the way it works is crucial to delivering its strategy. The Company committed to dramatically simplifying its organisation and processes, while creating an innovative environment, including through co-location on a more focused footprint.
This restructuring with a previously announced programme will create a combined Phase 4 programme that entails an estimated global headcount reduction of about 5,050 over the 2013-2016 period.
Those initiatives have been expanded in order to create further headroom to invest behind the pipeline and key growth platforms. Additional activities include the exit of R&D activities in Bangalore, India, and the exit from branded generics in certain Emerging Markets to further reduce costs and increase flexibility.
- to keep investing in diabetes, where its presence has been bolstered by a recent $4 billion deal to take full control of an alliance with Bristol-Myers Squibb.
- to throw resources behind Brilinta, which has got off to a slow start.
- Multiple ongoing trials wth innovative immuno-oncology portfolio.

item.title: Allergan Q4 Figures Demonstrate Strong Momentum
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: With fourth quarter sales growth above Q3 up 15.6% in local currencies and 14.6% in US dollar, Allergan met its long-term goal of growing sales in double digit figures with full year sales up 11.7% to $6.2bn. Strong growth momentum continues to be seen across all businesses. A new BOTOX X programme, highlighted but not disclosed (possible new serotype) has one early candidate scheduled to enter clinical development at the end of this year.
BOTOX sales
Increased in Q4 by 12.1% in local currencies and by 10.7% in dollars. With full-year performance at 13.2% in local currencies and 12.2% in dollars.
In terms of the split of therapeutic and esthetic sales for 2013, therapeutic indications accounted for 54% of the total and grew 16% in local currencies and 17% in dollars. Whilst aesthetic indications constituting 46% grew 10% in local currencies and 8% in dollars and experienced some minor share loss, For crow's feet it now has national licenses in 21 countries across the European region with only Italy outstanding amongst the major markets.
Regulatory Approvals
Regarding BOTOX for overactive bladder recent approvals have been obtaine in Canada, the U.K, the Netherlands, Switzerland, Slovakia, Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Israel, Hong Kong and reimbursement by the Australian government. In the U.K. it also received the additional indication of lower limb spasticity as announced yesterday.

Pricing
In the U.S. a small price increase on Jan 2 was announced for both BOTOX therapeutic and BOTOX cosmetic and it was sone in such a way to avoid any pull-forward sales into December.
Urology Performance
Regarding urology Pyott noted that in the US Allergan has been able to secure coverage in December for 81% of commercial lines, for 82% of Medicare lines, and good levels of approvals for prior authorizations. About 4,500 urologists and uro gynecologists are regular uses of BOTOX of a universe of about 13,000 physicians many of whom do not treat incontinence at all.
In Europe Allergan has invested heavily in medical education and training for chronic migraine, urogenic and overactive bladder but only in those countries where it has secured reimbursement.

Aesthetics
Allergan suggests its surveys reveal that BOTOX cosmetics' share remains high at 79% in December versus 84% in December of 2012. With DYSPORT at 14% share versus 15 a year ago, with XEOMIN at 6 1/2% versus 1% a year ago as this was when the product was being reintroduced into the market after the lifting of the injunction. A significant amount of XEOMIN's current share it was suggested stems from free samples.
In western Europe Allergan estimates the market is growing mid single digits with Vistabel or BOTOX growing slightly in excess of market despite strong competition from Merck.
Investment Behind Botox
The group continues to invest heavily in DTC advertising to support this growth particularly on Restasis and Botox for chronic migraine and has plans to further leverage its SG&A expenses in 2014.
Botox Development Pipeline
On the BOTOX side, Pyott claimed to be "pretty excited" just with new indications for BOTOX. Key points emphasised were:-
  • PhIIB for osteoarthritis pain - initial data probably later this year but an intention to move forward with the program.
  • Starting phII for depression & phII for premature ejaculation underway.
  • BOTOX X programs not previously disclosed for competitive reasons but one is likely to enter the clinic at the end of this year. Given the reference to the TSI programme below, this potentially could be a new serotype.
  • Collaboration with Medytox, "so they have a liquid formulation, we've been meeting with them, the collaboration's going very well and I'm sure David or myself or Jeff will update you on the development plan as soon as we finalize those plans, but a lot of resources are going there."
  • Program that target exocytosis for pain. In ph2 for higher dose, if that works that's an exciting program, not quite BOTOX, it's really a novel platform but potentially in the neuropathic pain platform we're excited about that, it's a larger need.
M&A Strategy
When questione about this Pyott responded:-
"In addition to internally derived programs, we'll be grafting in new technology. On top of that, of course, we're always looking to see are there other products or companies that would fit our business model, but also fulfill the very rigorous criteria of providing growth. Because clearly with our strong internal growth, we would have no interest in buying and I'll exaggerate, a product or a company that we're only growing 2 or 3% because all we'd do would be diluting our already really strong internal performance so I hope that gives you a good framework about how we think about these targets"
"In summary, we're always looking to see if we can add other neurology or urology products to our product range where we can leverage the relationships we've created and also leverage the fixed cost of our sales and marketing organizations."
2014 Full Year Guidance
Total product net sales between $6,650 million and $6,950 million, excluding any anticipated revenue from the transition service agreements related to the sale of the obesity intervention business.
  • Total specialty pharmaceuticals net sales between $5,720 million and $5,960 million.
  • Total core medical devices net sales between $930 million and $990 million.
  • ALPHAGANÂ® franchise product net sales between $460 million and $490 million.
  • LUMIGANÂ® franchise product net sales between $590 million and $620 million.
  • RESTASISÂ® product net sales between $1,030 million and $1,070 million.
  • BOTOXÂ® product net sales between $2,180 million and $2,280 million.
  • LATISSEÂ® product net sales between $100 million and $110 million.
  • Breast aesthetics product net sales between $390 million and $420 million.
  • Facial aesthetics product net sales between $540 million and $570 million.
  • Non-GAAP cost of sales to product net sales ratio at approximately 13%..
  • Non-GAAP selling, general and administrative expenses to product net sales ratio between 37% and 38%.
  • Non-GAAP research and development expenses to product net sales ratio at approximately 16.5%.
source: www.allergan.com

item.title: Kyowa Hakko Kirin Commences PhIII Development of ARQ197 for HCC
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: KHK has announced today the start of a phIII trial in Japan in patients with c-MET diagnositc high inoperable hepatocellular carcinoma treated with one prior sorafenib therapy.
Study Design - NCT02029157
Double-blind placebo controlled study to compare PFS of ARQ197 vs. placebo. 160 patients will be enrolled.
Licensing Status
ARQ197 an oral agent whose molecular target is c-MET was discovered by ArQule Inc. KHK in-licensed development and commercialisation rights to ARQ197 in Japan and some parts of Asia (China, Korea and Taiwan) in April 2007.
Satus of ArQule's Development Programme
ArQule, Inc. recently (January 16th) provided clinical updates on its ongoing pivotal Phase 3 METIV-HCC trial in hepatocellular carcinoma conducted by the Company and its partner, Daiichi Sankyo Co., Ltd.,
METIV-HCC Trial
The Data Monitoring Committee (DMC) of the METIV-HCC trial recommended continuation of the ongoing pivotal Phase 3 METIV-HCC trial of tivantinib as a single agent in hepatocellular carcinoma with a lower dose of tivantinib, 120 milligrams (mg) tablets administered twice daily (BID). This decision followed the DMC's review of data analyses from a predefined number of patients who received this lower dose.
A recently completed safety analyses among patients treated with 120 mg BID tivantinib tablets showed that the incidence of neutropenia was reduced with this lower dose. In addition, pharmacokinetic analyses from this patient cohort, reviewed by the DMC, demonstrated that the plasma exposure of the 120 mg BID tablets dose was comparable to the exposure achieved with the 240 mg BID capsules dose employed in the Phase 2 trial, with similar medians and overlapping ranges.
A dose reduction from 240 mg BID tablets to 120 mg tablets BID was implemented in September, 2013 following the observation of a higher incidence of neutropenia in the initial phase of the METIV-HCC trial than was observed in the Phase 2 trial in the same patient population where a 240 mg BID capsule dose was administered. Certain enhanced patient monitoring procedures had been temporarily instituted to confirm the safety profile of the lower dose.
The METIV-HCC trial is a pivotal randomized, double-blind study of tivantinib as single agent therapy in previously treated patients with MET diagnostic-high, inoperable HCC. The primary endpoint is overall survival in the intent-to-treat population, and the secondary endpoint is progression free survival in the same population. METIV-HCC is being conducted under a Special Protocol Assessment (SPA)
source: www.arqule.com

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: GW Pharma Q1 Figures - Key Takeaways
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Total revenues for the three months ended Dec 31st were £7.5m compared to £5.2m in the corresponding period last year. Net loss was £2.8m compared to a profit of £2.1m in 2013. A successful follow-on offering of American Depositary Shares on NASDAQ in January 2014 raising total gross proceeds of $101.1 million has put the group in a strong position both to pursue the Epidiolex® development program for childhood epilepsy, a product which GW is very enthusiastic about but also to develop its earlier cannabinoid programme including a phIb/2a programme for the treatment of recurrent Glioblastoma.
The 44% increase in revenues vs Q1 13 will have been largely derived from increased uptake of Sativex for spasticity, but at this juncture we do not have a picture of in-market sales through the group's licensees. However, in terms of life cycle management and geographic expansion GW continues to make good progress as it highlighted below:
  • Phase 3 cancer pain trials in recruitment - top-line data due towards the end of 2014. Data intended to lead to a New Drug Application (NDA) filing with the FDA in the U.S.
  • Phase 3 IND opened with the FDA for Sativex as a treatment for Multiple Sclerosis (MS) spasticity; request for Special Protocol Assessment (SPA) submitted to the FDA
  • Recent regulatory approvals in France and Switzerland as a treatment for MS spasticity; Sativex now approved for use in 25 countries
  • Agreement with Ipsen to promote and distribute Sativex in Latin America
There is also significant additional on-going clinical trial activity for cannabinoid pipeline product candidates
  • Phase 2a trial data of GWP42003 for the treatment of ulcerative colitis ongoing - data expected in mid-2014
  • Phase 2b dose ranging trial of GWP42004 in type-2 diabetes expected to commence in H1 2014
  • Phase 2a trial of GWP42003 for the treatment of schizophrenia expected to commence in H1 2014
  • Phase 1b/2a clinical trial underway of GWP42002:GWP42003 for the treatment of Recurrent Glioblastoma Multiforme (GBM), with safety cohort data expected in 2014. Patent Notice of Allowance issued for the use of cannabinoids in treating GBM

item.title: Astellas Reorganizes Global Management Structure
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The responsibilities of the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) will be reinforced. From the beginning of Q2:14, Global Development Head, Global Regulatory Affairs Head, Global Clinical & Research Quality Assurance Head and Global Quality Assurance will report to CMO.
The position of QA and RA Head of Astellas Pharma Inc. will be dissolved.
The company reported that the objectives of this restructuration is to enhance global product compliance and the overall synergy with Global Development.
Source: Astellas

item.title: Galderma Divests Osteoarthritis Assets to Bioventus
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Bioventus which previously had exclusive distribution rights in EU, Canada and Australia will now controls all future plans and distribution outside of the US. Galderma will continue to manufacture DUROLANE, a joint-fluid treatment containing non-animal stabilized hyaluronic acid (NASHA).
Osteoarthritis is no more a core indication for Galderma.
The company has been focused on 2 segments: Medical solutions for the skin, and Aesthetic & Corrective.
However it has kept the manufacturing of its patented NASHA technology.
The acquisition is a very good fit with Bioventus activities. DUROLANE has been treating patients for 12 years.
The company is a global leader in active orthopaedic healing. Product portfolio lists:
  • Exogen (US waves to activate cells near the site of the fractured bones
  • SUPARTZ and DUROLANE (joint injection therapies for OA)
  • Muskuloskeletal diagnostic equipment partnered with Esaote North America.

item.title: Approval of BOTOX® for Adult LLS in the UK
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: BOTOX® has been approved by the Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) for the treatment of ankle disability due to lower limb spasticity associated with stroke in adults. The toxin becomes the first and only neuromodulator to be approved specifically for both upper and lower limb spasticity in adults who had a stroke.
152,000 new cases each year (Stroke Association, Stoke Statistics available at http://www.stroke.org.uk/resource-sheet/stroke-statistics Last accessed January 2014).
This new indication is based on an multi-centre, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study, assessing its efficacy in patients with post-stroke lower limb spasticity affecting the ankle.
A total of 120 patients were randomized to a single treatment of Allergan's Botulinum toxin type A (300 units) or placebo. Patients who were enrolled in this study had had their stroke on average approximately 6 years earlier.
Patients treated with Botulinum toxin type A achieved a significant improvement in muscle tone compared to those treated with placebo, using the Modified Ashworth Scale (MAS) ankle score and measuring baseline to week 12 results
Significant improvements compared to placebo were also observed at the individual post-treatment visits at weeks 4, 6 and 8
Botulinum toxin type A treatment was associated with a significant improvement in the investigator's clinical global impression (CGI) of functional disability compared to placebo.

item.title: Cheaper Version of Merz' Radiesse Showcased at IMCAS 2014
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Luminera, an R&D company and manufacturer of injectable medical devices in the aesthetic field, presented its Crystalys dermal filler (a calcium hydroxyapatite based filler), as a "generic" of Merz' Radiesse, the sole dermal filler in this category. The substance produces a very natural result, doesn't migrate, and side effects are rare.
Crystalys has been marketed in Israel since September 2011 for soft tissue augmentation.
The company recently conducted a PMS among 173 patients to assess its safety and efficacy.
  • "Post marketing study of safety and efficacy of Crystalys, a calcium hydroxyapatite based filler for facial soft tissue augmentation - Tsvi Segal, MD; Ana Schwartz, MD; Konstantin Konfino, MD, PhD.
Panaxia is an R&D and a manufacturer of medical devices and cosmeceuticals, luminera is the injectable aesthetic line.

item.title: Astellas Q3 2013 Figures - Key Takeaways Including PREVAIL Data
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Astellas's third quarter figures illustrate how the success of the prostate cancer drug XTANDI and the OAB drug Mirabegron are contributing to the group's overall strong growth. XTANDI's annualised sales are likely to exceed $400m this year a figure ahead of internal expectations. Some of the key highlights of the recently disclosed PREVAIL data were also presented during the group's earning presentation (see below), with a few interesting answers prompted by analyst questions.
Overall XTANDI has been launched in 19 countries. Early 2014 is the target date for an NDA filing of the PREVAIL data.
In the Q/A that followed one analyst questioned whether the delay to chemotherapy was going to be one of the more influential properties of the drug from a urologist perspective and also on the comparative level of fatigue seen vs. Zytiga (where of course steroid use helps to alleviate fatigue).
Yazushi Miyazawa from Astellas acknolwedged the attractiveness of the time to initiate chemo data but also that this data has to be reviewed by the authorities so it is too early to gauge what kind of impact can be expected. However, he did suggest it was the correct way to think about the data.
He also noted that fatigue has been previously reported with XTANDI but compartively with regard to Zytiga further analysis is required before further comments will be made, other than it is not considered worrisome.
Whilst a lot of data on enzalutamide was presented at ASCO GI, nothing was disclosed on the effect of XTANDI on bone metastases. That data does exist and will it seems be presented on another as yet to be disclosed occaision.

item.title: Furiex Provides Update on its IBS-d Drug
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Furiex' eluxadoline (oral locally-acting mu opioid receptor agonist and delta opioid receptor antagonist) met the main goal of two arge Ph3 trials by significantly alleviating diarrhea and abdominal pain. In the US, the company plans to apply by mid-year for approval of the drug, and expects to seek EU approval in early 2015. Management reported it is still considering the alternatives to partner the product.
Eluxadoline was tested at 2 doses against a placebo over the course of 12 weeks to meet requirements by the US FDA, and for 26 weeks for European health regulators, in Ph3 studies involving 2,428 patients.
NCT01553591
NCT01553747
In 2011, Furiex acquired full exclusive license rights from Janssen to develop and commercialize eluxadoline.

http://www.furiex.com/about-us/background/

item.title: Daewoong to Supply Products to Azerbaijan and Georgia
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Daewoong has entered into contracts with Azerbaijan’s Sanimed and Georgia’s Eczamed to supply a range of products worth $15M over the next 5 years. Daewoong expects to use these contracts to open up additional distribution channels into CIS.
Before those contracts Daewoong was used to sign the export contracts wth Russia and CIS every year.
  • Neovist, the CT contrast agent, signed in 2011
  • Easyef (external solution/ ointment), the diabetic foot ulcer treatment drug, signed in 2012
  • Luphere Depot, the prostate cancer treatment drug, inked in 2013
Azerbaijan’s Sanimed specializes in the pharmaceutical import and distribution and has made steady strides with the annual sales growth exceeding 45%.
Georgia’s Eczamed distributes pharmaceutical products to the neighboring CIS such as Turkey and Kazakhstan.
Source: Daewoong

item.title: Botox / Myobloc Comparison Stuy to Assess Muscular Atrophy in Spastic Patients
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Although the benefits of botulinum therapy is indisputable, muscle atrophy is one of the main adverse effect noticed. A new small pilot study will evaluate if there is a statistically significant difference in the degree of muscle atrophy using BTX-A vs BTX-B. PE will measure the volume and cross-sectional area of the muscle.
Sponsor: Georgetown U.
Collaborator: Solstice Neurosciences
Recruitment: approx 10 men and women aged 18 or older with spasticity secondary to either a disorder or trauma, such as a spinal cord injury (SCI), a brain injury, a tumor, a stroke, multiple sclerosis (MS), or a peripheral nerve injury.
Timelines: study planned to start last month (Jan 2014) - completion date: Jan 2015.
Dosage: Botox 100U / Myobloc 5000U
PI: Fernando Pagan, MD
Source: NCT02052024

item.title: Valeant To Buy PreCision Dermatology For Up To $500m
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Valeant had been expected to make another acquisition in the dermatology space and whilst this is smaller than might have been anticipated (2014 forecast sales of $130m) it fits well alongside its existing medical dermatology portfolio.
Acquisition Rational
Commenting on the deal Valeant's Chairman and CEO Michael Pearson noted that "PreCision Dermatology has a wide range of medical dermatology products, treating a number of topical disease states such as acne and atopic dermatitis, and should bring tremendous value to Valeant's medical dermatology portfolio Furthermore, PreCision's diversified portfolio of products enjoys high physician loyalty, premium product quality and lifecycle management opportunities that will enhance our future growth strategies. We believe this acquisition will strengthen Valeant's product portfolio and solidify our position as a leader in dermatology."
PreCision Business Profile
PreCision operates in two key segments: Onset Dermatologics, which focuses on prescription therapies, and PrecisionMD®, which focuses on physician dispensed products. The Company is based in Cumberland, Rhode Island and has approximately 175 employees.
Analysts View On The Acquisition
BMO Capilal Markets: "At ~3.8x sales, it may appear that Valeant might be over-paying for this company; however, PreCision is a growing company with several assets in dermatology that treat a number topical disease states such asacne and atopic dermatitis. This is a growing and mostly cash-pay market that Valeant is very familiar with, given itsexisting dermatology product portfolio. Valeant should clearly be able to leverage its existing dermatologyinfrastructure to market PerCision's products, and as such we have little doubt that the deal would indeed be immediately accretive."
It sees this deal is yet another example that there are plenty of small-mid sized acquisition opportunities available for Valeant.
Cannacord Genuity - MA strategy as a growth driver - "We view PreCision as a smaller acquisition for Valeant, which is in line with our expectqations for small to mid-sized deals in the near-term. However, we note that Valeant continues to pursue a "merger of equals" that could de-lever the balance sheet. "

item.title: AbbVie's Q4 13 Revenues Led by Humira
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Management highlighted that initial data from the first of two pivotal studies of elagolix for endometriosis are expected H2:14. Fourth-quarter sales were led by the continued strength of HUMIRA (Global HUMIRA sales increased 13.4% to $3.01 bln; U.S. HUMIRA sales grew 18.1% to $1.67 bln). The Humira patent does not expire until 2016, however "possible successors are already being studied". Detailed sales of Lupron are provided below.
Lupron continues to hold a leadership position and maintains significant share of the market. Management expects Lupron sales to be down "modestly from 2013".

  • Int'l: 53
  • Total: 209 (down 5% versus PY)

item.title: Hyperhidrosis Update at IMCAS 2014
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The one-hour session was chaired by Davi de Lacerda (dermatologist, Brazil) and David Goldberg (dermatologist, USA). A review of the management of the condition provided recent data on botulinum toxins A (but not on the topical toxin), on a new dedicated ultra-sound system having just received European marking approval, and a new RF technology developed by Alma Lasers.
David Golberg (US dermatologist) introduced the session highlighting that:
>30M people have the condition >> 1 in 5 Americans (18-49 years) experiences excessive sweat.
- New findings from a comparative double-blinded dtudy show that Onabotulinum toxin A (Botox) and Incobotulinumtoxin A (Xeomin) seem to be comparable in terms of anhidrotic effect (short-term results), duration of benefits (long-term efficacy), muscle strength reduction (safety), pain related to injections (tolerability), and treatment satisfaction expressed by patients.
- On January 6th 2014 Miramar Labs®'s miraDry® System received Conformite European (CE) Mark approval for the treatment of primary axillary hyperhidrosis.
The miraDry procedure uses microwave energy to provide a non-invasive, lasting solution to axillary hyperhidrosis.
Delivers energy non-invasively to the area under the arm where the sweat glands reside, creating localized heat to destroy and eliminate the glands, which are not necessary to cool the body. Since sweat glands do not regenerate, results are lasting.
Each miraDry procedure takes approximately one hour in the doctor's office. The full treatment plan requires two procedures to maximize results. The procedure is safe and the results can be seen almost immediately. Since the procedure is non-invasive, there is little to no downtime, so patients can go about their normal routine after treatment.

item.title: IMCAS 2014 - Key Takeaways From The Industry Tribune
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Two of the more interesting session at this year's Industry Tribune event at IMCAS were a presentation by New York based Michel Dyens & Co covering M&A transactional trends within the aesthetic market and then individual company presentations given by Galderma, Allergan & Merz during a session on the "Big Players". Additionally, in the "Breaking News" session it was noted that TEOXANE is to collaborate with US newcomer Alphaeon (Strathspey Crown) and become the European aesthetic distributor for Daewoong's new toxin DWP450..
A selection of some of the key slides plus comments are highlighted below. Apologies for the quality of the photos. It was a difficult forum in which to capture data.
Jean-Yves Coste from Michel Dyens noted that a robust continuation of the momentum observed in the last few years is expected. Although a flattening in numbers was seen in 2013 there are a few factors pointing to an increase in M&A in 2014 The US and developed countries maintain their lead both in terms of number of transactions and valuations across all sub-sectors.
H
Highlighted were the three key trends that are underpinning the M&A trends but uppermost is the desire by patients for technological sophistication which is prompting companies to continue to seek technological innovation. Acquisition multiples are in general expanding with the entry ticket multiple now around 3.8x EV. However, there are differrences seen between the different sectors wwith medical aesthetic multiples tending to decrease, dermal filler multiples stable, contouring and electric device expanding and dermacosmetic witnessing a growth in multiples. The latter because it is now recognised that cosmoceuticals are the first-line of treatment before patients undergo more invasive facial treatments
Galderma Humberio Antunes
Humberio addressed the question "How patients expectations & awareness will influence the aesthetic market".
He made a couple of points in terms of introductory remarks.
1) The vast majority of patients want to look better but in the main they do not want injections on their face.
2) Changing demographics come with growing skin health needs.
3) The aging demographic presents a major opportunity for aesthetic companies. Consumer types are broadening and they are better educated.
He also highlighted the results of a survey Galderma has undertaken called the IMPACT study, which notes that
a) 43% of patients will definitely continue with the same practitioner. however,
b) 52% have changed practitioner since their first treatment as the customer service was not satisfying enough
In terms of choice of brands 40 KOLS interviewed as part of the survey noted the following criteria as influential in terms of their choice
  • Quality of the products
  • Innovation
  • Customer centricity and support
From an innovative perspective he then followed with a description of the company's new Rosacea product which also has application for melisma and noted that the company has a new BoNT in PhII development for the US & Canada. He stated it will be super pure and created from the group's own proprietary product. We are aware that this is an injectable liquid formulation.
Merz Philip Burchard CEO
Merz was asked to address the question "How to operated as a W/W challenger?
Mr Buchard noted that the group was pursuing and increased focus on aesthetics and that the company would soon achieve €1bn in sales. He remarked that growth in profitability was being derived from the aesthetic business.
He commented on the 5 reasons why the market is attractive
  1. Double digit growth rate
  2. Scope for innovation
  3. Growing acceptance of procedures
  4. New growth markets offer continued acceleration
  5. The fragmented nature of the market
He claimed that Merz is aiming to take market share from competitors and that a presence in the US market is crucial. Also crucial is innovation, the pursuit of new indications, new treatment regimens, new technology and new NMEs. He emphasised that a mid-sized aspiring player still needs to focus on innovation.
Commenting on the fragmented nature of the market, he noted that there are <10 companies with <$200m sales, so he expects consolidation to continue. There are a large number of mid-sized companies that may need re-financing and where there is an opportunity to collaborate
Overall Mr Buchard sees 5 potential success factors for Merz's aesthetic business:-
  • Gain share through strong execution
  • Drive innovation
  • Win new patients
  • Enter new markets; and.
  • Participate in the M&A market
Allergan Paul Navarre President of Allergan EMEA
Mr Navarre was asked to address "How to maintain leadership in a more competitive market?"
He acknowledge that all aesthetic markets are becoming more competitive than they were, with 9 toxins in the market now compared to two 15 years ago and filler and breast implant markets also becoming increasingly competitive.
He emphasised that he believes competition is a good thing as it stimulates the market to be innovative and to perform. It allows you he suggested to show who you are and what you stand for.
He stated that Allergan always asks itself the question about whether it is bringing value to both the physician and the patient and that one company it tries to emulate is Apple. David Pyott apparently is quoted as saying he admires Apple because of its ability to innovate
It recognised that Apple's 4 pillars that have helped the company to reinforce its position and create leadership are
  • Innovation- it has changed the way we live through innovative product design and advertising
  • Shaped the market by always trying to build out the market
  • Focused on customer centricity e.g specialised Apple stores which offer fantastic customer service
  • Simplicity - regardless of innovation it has kept its products simple
The manner in which Allergan is trying to mimmick Apple was illustrated:-
  • Innovation - introduced two new products in the aesthetic market in the last 12 months e.g. new Juvederm range and new indication for Vistabel
  • Shaping the market - focus is on broad DTC advertising and now moving to digital media
  • Customer centricity - developed a consulting programme for physicians and educated over 4,700 clinicians on its new toxin innovation over the last few months. It also never compromises on quality
  • Simplicity - Allergan believes the highest level of sophistication is simplicity
Finally he posed the question as to whether Allergan has succeeded, claiming that it has as
Vistable revenues have grown 53% over the last 4 years. Its fillers have gown by 57% over the same period and its breast implants by 17%.
Teoxane Distributorship News
Valerie Taupin Teoxane's CEO highlighted the success of her company which she founded 10 years ago. To date it has sold over 5 million syringes of its filler and has consistently registerd double-digit growth. Its products are available in 80 countries through 65 distributorships and in late 2013 its signed a license agreement with Alphaeon, (Strathspey Crown) for US distribution of its fillers, a company it met at IMCAS the previous year.
Valerie noted that the main reasons why she had chosen to partner with this company were threefold:- the very high level of experience of the team (ex-Allergan), its focus on the cash-pay market and the KOL network around which the company is formed (it is operating with a new business model) (see Neurology7257: Daewoong Still Awaits Toxin Approval In Korea But Analysts Are Impressed With The Export Deal It Has Negotiated).
Finally, she was pleased to announce the extension of the partnership with Alphaeon regarding the distribution of its in-licensed toxin from Daewoong across Europe.
Alphaeon
Robert Grant from Strrathspey Crown also spoke briefly about his company, highlighting how its uses a crowd intelligence platform called SHOUT MD to derive great data from its KOL network, data that is very valuable to the industry in terms of highlighting upcoming trends, even to the point that it asks its clinicians what products to bring into the company portfolio such as our new toxin. He noted that Strathspey has a global license to the Daewoong product both for aesthetic and therapeutic indicaitons but that it doesn't plan to commercialise the therapeutic line as its focus is on non-reimbursed products
Source Industry Tribune IMCAS 2014

item.title: IMCAS 2014 - Update of Toxins and Dermal Fillers in Asia
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: For this year congress, a series of IMCAS sessions were dedicated to the differences between Caucasian and Asian faces and the criteria of preference to focus on when it comes to botulinum toxin and dermal fillers injections. Patient trends, market drivers/limiters and prospectives were discussed by a panel of speakers in the aesthetic, medicine and dermatologic fields. Key messages are provided below.
Key findings from 5 surveys undertaken from 20112 (see sources below) were reported.
The Asian market is growing rapidly in numbers, both procedures and physicians.
The Asia Pacific region will experience the most growth in facial injectable procedures globally. Of note, the decrease of the US market.
The Global Facial Injectables Market to Grow at a CAGR of 7% to reach $2.8 bln by 2018
The N. American, European, Asia Pacfific and Latin American facial aesthetics markets are expected to grow at CAGRs of approx. 7%, 3%, 10% and 9% respectively.
Top Indications with Toxins
Market Landscape
Botulinum toxin procedure share by brand and % of respondents
In the botulinum toxin segment, local competitors are also leading competitors in the market.
Dermal filler procedure share by brand, and % of respondents
  • Botox, Botulax and Neuronox are the top 3 brands. Top indications include masseter, (age<34); crow's feet (age 35 to >45).
  • When it comes to filler Restylane, Anteis and Juvederm are the most popular. Top indications include nose (age <34), nasal folds (age 35-44).
China is becoming the fast growing country when it comes to non invasive procedures.
  • Neuromodulators still dominate the market segment with 50% Botox and 50% 'others'.
  • Dermal fillers are limited in the public hospitals. Only 3 are allowed: Artecoll, Restylane and collagen fillers (20% of the Chinese market).
Peter HUANG (plastic surgeon in Taiwan) highlighted that product safety is a major concern in China; approx. 90% of products are counterfeited, cost probably being the main reason. He listed the 11 injectables products appoved by the Chinese FDA (9 and 2 ).

item.title: Korlym's Cushing Syndrome Sales Start To Gain Momentum
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Corcept reported net revenue for the fourth quarter of $4.1m and $10.4m for the full year with the expectation that group/Korlym revenue will grow to $24m in 2014. Cash at the year end was $54.9m
2014 Guidance
The company estimates 2014 net revenue based on Korlym sales will be between $24m and $28m.
Korlym's Performance
Korlym for Cushing's disease reported a 56% increased in the fourth quarter compared to the prior quarter, a momentum that is expected to continue into 2014.
Other Key Developments
  • Enrollment in a PhI study of mifepristone in triple negative breast cancer to commence in the next few days.
  • PhIII interim results from the group's trial with Korlym in psychotic depression expected in Q214,
  • Advance two its next-generation selective GR antagonists into the clinic in 2H14
Successful commercialisation of Korlym for Cushing;s syndrome remains a key strategic priority for 2014.


Source: www.corcept.com

item.title: Allergan's Presentation At JP Morgan
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Thanks to the team at this year's JP Morgan H/C conference, we have slides from Allergan's presentation to share with you. It is interesting to note 2017 growth projections for both the therapeutic and aesthetic neuromodulator markets valued at $2.6bn and just short of $2bn respectively.
Whilst we don't have access to the presentation transcript their dosen't appear to be anything exceptionally new in the content other than the manner in which Alelrgan is redefining facial aesthetics, its growth projections and its perspective that with new therapeutic neuromodulator markets it takes an estimated 5-7 years to reack peak sales in the US and a further 2 years in overseas markets because of prising and reimbursement issues.

item.title: Roche Q4 Figures - Key Takeaways
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Roche reported strong growth with group revenues up 6% in line with guidance and EPS up 10%. Pharmaceutical revenue growth +3% (c.c. +7%) with operating profit similarly up 7% at CER. We now have confirmation that Roche will not make regulatory submissions for its oral octreotide until 2015.
With regard to oral octreotide, partnered with Chiasma, Daniel O'Day COO made the following comment:-
"We'll be getting results from that this year with the potential to file next year depending on those results in acromegaly. Just so you know this is an oral medication and the current standard of care is infusion by rather large bore needle. So, it could be a significant advance for patients."
A filing in 2015 is also validated by a recent Roche job posting for a Senior Product Manager for oral octreotide posted by Roche in the US which mentions an FDA submission in Q1 2015 with an anticipated launch in Q1 2016. Thanks to Jean-Pierre Covilard for alerting us to this..

item.title: re: Key Messages from Novartis FY2013 Results
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Key Messages from Novartis FY2013 Results 
Comment: David Epstein reported net sales in 2013 increased to $57.9 billion (+2%, +4%cc), and pharmaceutical division grew to $32.2 billion (+3% cc vs previous year). Emerging markets, which are listed as one of the company's strategic priorities for 2014, grew +9% vs. 2012 in cc, lead by Russia and China. FDA action and CHMP opinion for Signifor LAR in acromegaly are expected during H2:14. Key slides are provided below.  ...
In its full length press release, Novartis elaborates on its Signifor filing. This occurred in the fourth quarter both in the US & EU with the regulatory submission made for the treatment of patients with acromegaly for whom medical therapy is appropriate (a fairly broad label). similar to the approach it took regarding the submission for Signifor in Cushing's disease.
Signifor currently approved for the treatment of adult patients with Cushing's disease for whom pituitary surgery is not an option or has not been curative. Whether such a broad label will be granted for acromegaly remains to be seen, especially in light of the high incidence of hyperglycaemia observed with the drug, which suggests in practice usage could well be limited to octreotide and lanreotide failures.

item.title: Diagnostic for Patients with GEP-NETS Granted ODD by EMA
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: OctreoPharm's OPS202 (future trade name SOMscan) is a new 68Gallium-labeled radiopharmaceutical in clinical development for positron emission tomography (PET, PET/CT) with the potential to detect even smallest lesions of NETs. Depending on the labeled radionuclide OPS202 can be used for diagnosis (68Ga) as well as for therapy (90Y).
Company claims that the whole diagnostic procedure can be completed in 1 hour and provides quantification capability that might be improved compared to other radio-labeled compounds.
In Oct 2011, OctreoPharm Sciences GmbH received the WW exclusive license for the development and commercialization of SOMscan, from Novartis Pharma AG.
Under the terms of the agreement, Novartis is to receive an upfront payment and milestone payments upon regulatory approvals, as well as royalties.
Novartis has the right to re-acquire the rights to SOMscan on pre-agreed financial terms.
About OctreoPharm Sciences GmbH
OctreoPharm Sciences GmbH, located in Berlin (Germany) is a privately held clinical development company focusing on radiopharmaceuticals for the diagnosis and therapeutic control of tumors.
Current shareholder of OctreoPharm Sciences GmbH are:
- Eckert & Ziegler AG, VC Funds Technology managed by IBB Berlin GmbH, KfW Mittelstandsbank, Eckert Life Science Accelerator GmbH, OctreoPharm (Holding) GmbH and the Chinese investor Shaanxi Xinyida Investment Co. Ltd.

Comments
re: Diagnostic for patients with GEP-NETS Granted ODD by EMA
OctreoPharm's OPS202 has received US FDA ODD for the management of neuroendocrine tumors.
Status: Ph1/2
MOA: has the potential to improve the Imaging of NET patients
Please note that Novartis does not have an option or any other rights for OctreoPharm’s OPS202 diagnostic (SomScan). Novartis had an option for another product (a Pasireotide based diagnostic) that OctreoPharm is not developing anymore. The confusion comes from the fact that at the time they had used the name Som Scan for that product as well.

item.title: Key Messages from Novartis FY2013 Results
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: David Epstein reported net sales in 2013 increased to $57.9 billion (+2%, +4%cc), and pharmaceutical division grew to $32.2 billion (+3% cc vs previous year). Emerging markets, which are listed as one of the company's strategic priorities for 2014, grew +9% vs. 2012 in cc, lead by Russia and China. FDA action and CHMP opinion for Signifor LAR in acromegaly are expected during H2:14. Key slides are provided below.
Pharmaceuticals delivered net sales of USD 32.2 billion (0%, +3% cc) for the full year, driven by strong volume growth (+9 percentage points) and pricing (+1 percentage point), which more than offset the impact of generic competition (USD 2.2 billion, -7 percentage points). Growth products grew 25% in constant currencies and contributed USD 12.3 billion or 38% of division net sales in 2013, compared to 31% in 2012.
Novartis is still awaiting some cheaper, copycat competition for Diovan, since Ranbaxy Laboratories <RANB.NS>has faced regulatory delays for its generic version.

Comments
In its full length press release, Novartis elaborates on its Signifor filing. This occurred in the fourth quarter both in the US & EU with the regulatory submission made for the treatment of patients with acromegaly for whom medical therapy is appropriate (a fairly broad label). similar to the approach it took regarding the submission for Signifor in Cushing's disease.
Signifor currently approved for the treatment of adult patients with Cushing's disease for whom pituitary surgery is not an option or has not been curative. Whether such a broad label will be granted for acromegaly remains to be seen, especially in light of the high incidence of hyperglycaemia observed with the drug, which suggests in practice usage could well be limited to octreotide and lanreotide failures.

item.title: XTANDI® PREVAIL Final Results in Pre-Chemo Met Endpoints
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Preliminary final rsults demonstrate a statistically significant reduction both in the risk of death and a delay in cancer progression in men with metastatic prostate cancer who have a rising PSA and few, if any, symptoms. Astellas plans to submit regulatory applications to the FDA and EMA early this year. In Japan, a review by regulators is set for Feb 3. It could be approved in Japan without any pre-chemo/post-chemo restrictions. Further medical details from the ASCO GU presentation will be published tomorrow.
- XTANDI® reduced the risk of death by 29% and progression free survival by 81% compared with a placebo.
- Men taking XTANDI® on average went 17 months longer than those in the placebo group before requiring chemotherapy - 28 months versus 10.8 months.
- Nearly 4 out of 5 patients in the XTANDI® group experienced a PSA decline of 50% or more, compared to less than 4% in the placebo group (78% vs. 3.5%; p < 0.0001).
- Safety: XTANDI® did raise blood pressure in more than 13% of patients versus about 4% on placebo, but that was easily controlled by common hypertension medicines. Serious heart issues were observed in 2.8% of XTANDI® patients compared with 2.1% in the placebo group.
Investor at Barclays reported : " ... Based on our comparison of this data to that of the Zytiga Phase III COU-AA-302 study (see table below), we believe the results between Zytiga plus prednisone and Xtandi are largely comparable. However, when looking at the overall survival curves, we do see a noticeable difference in the initial months between the two curves – there is an early separation between the two arms of the study in the PREVAIL study and a later separation in the COU-AA-302 study. Overall, we believe this is explained by the fact that the comparator arm in the PREVAIL study was placebo, while in the COU-AA-302 study it was prednisone (an active drug in prostate cancer). Also 12% of PREVAIL patients had visceral metastases at baseline. While the treatment duration for Xtandi in the PREVAIL study is slightly longer relative to Zytiga plus prednisone in the COU-AA-302 study (16.6 months vs. 13.8 months), we note that the average duration is always shorter in real life than in a clinical trial."
- approved by the FDA on August 31, 2012 and is indicated for the treatment of patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) who have previously received docetaxel.
PREVAIL Design : http://www.clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT01212991?term=prevail+AND+ENZALUTAMIDE&rank=1

item.title: Medigene Acquisition of Trianta Boosts Immunotherapy Pipeline
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Medigene has acquired 100% of the Munich-based company, Trianta Immunotherapies GmbH for approx. €4M. Trianta is developing 3 T-cell cancer vaccines, with programs in clinical development to treat various tumour types (i;e AML and prostate).
Financial Terms
The acquisition is milestone-based with €4M upfront (corresponds to 1,017,811 newly issued shares) and milestone payments of up €5.9M in shares or cash.
Trianta Platforms
  • next generation antigen-tailored dendritic cell (DC) vaccines (being evaluated in 2 ongoing, externally funded investigator-initiated trials: a clinical Ph1/2 trial (NCT01734304) in acute myeloid leukemia (AML), and a clinical Ph2 trial in prostate cancer (NCT01197625) . Both trials are scheduled to complete 2016/2017.
  • T cell receptor (TCR)-based adoptive cell therapy
  • T cell-targeted antibodies (TABs)
Competitive Advantages of the DC Platform
Trianta’s DC vaccine is patient-derived (autologous) and an example of a third-generation candidate, which has been developed to display two key advantages: ‘fast’ and ‘polarised’. Whereas standard procedures to produce mDCs take seven days, Trianta scientists developed a protocol that delivers young mDCs in just three days, so-called ‘fast DCs’. These cells have been shown to be as effective as seven-day mDCs in processing and presentation of tumour-associated antigen, while also being more robust in withstanding the stress of electroporation required for efficient antigen loading and freezing for later use. This clearly provides significant manufacturing efficiencies over current practice, allows for 10 doses to be prepared in one go, and for these doses to be frozen (current shelf life more than two years).
As well as being ‘fast’, Trianta’s DCs have been developed to ‘polarise’ the T-cell response, to optimise the activation of natural killer cells. This is achieved primarily by the addition of toll-like receptor (TLR) agonists to the maturation mixture. TLR agonists can stimulate the mDCs to produce cytokines, with IL-12 seen to be the most important in terms of helping to polarise/optimise the immune response.
Trianta Mini Profile
Trianta was founded in late 2013 as a spin-off from the Helmholtz Zentrum, Munich and is the culmination of 15 years of extensive research in the field of immunotherapy.
Professor Dolores Schendel, the managing director of Trianta and director of the Institute for Molecular Immunology at the Helmholtz Zentrum, will become Medigene’s chief scientific officer and will be accompanied by her team of 15 immunotherapy specialists from the Helmholtz Zentrum.
Source: Medigene

item.title: UK NICE Issued Second Draft Guidance on Xtandi
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: In addition to the previously-issued guidance in which Xtandi was recommended for patients who progressed during or after one docetaxel-containing chemotherapy regimen, the new draft guidance excludes the treatment of patients which have previously been treated with JNJ’s Zytiga. Since Zytiga is approved both in the pre- and post-chemotherapy settings, this new draft guidance would restrict the number of eligible patients for Xtandi.
If formally adopted, new draft guidance will negatively affect the growth trajectory of Xtandi in UK.
Source: ThomsonOne; NICE; Barclay

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Revance To Proceed With IPO & Further Development Of Its Toxin Portfolio
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: Revance yesterday announced the initial public offering of its common stock to raise minimum gross proceeds of $70m to further fund the development of its topical toxin RT-001 for the treatment of crows feet lines. Meanwhile, plans for a phII study with the injectable formulation RT002 are underway for the treatment of glabellar lines.
IPO Terms
The company will issue 5 million shares at a price range between US$14 and US$16 per share. The company granted underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to 750,000 additional shares to cover over-allotments, if any. The company intends to list its common stock on The NASDAQ Global Market, under the symbol 'RVNC'.
Cowen and Company, LLC and Piper Jaffray & Co. are acting as joint book-running managers; whereas BMO Capital Markets Corp. is acting as underwriter; while Cooley LLP is acting as legal advisor to the company for the offering.
Use Of Funds

The company intends to use the proceeds for the following purposes:-
  • To fund R&D expenses associated with RT001 and RT002 manufacturing, quality and regulatory efforts;
  • To complete one Phase III clinical pivotal trial in the US, to continue a long term safety clinical trial and other associated programs relating to RT001 for the treatment of crow’s feet lines. Interestingly, there has been some soft intelligence regarding RT001 running into problems with skin allergies.:
  • To initiate first US Phase II clinical trial and associated programs relating to RT002 for the treatment of glabellar lines;
  • To make payments through 2014 under September 2011 term loan agreement with Hercules Technology Growth Capital, Inc., which bears interest at a rate equal to the greater of 9.85% or the prime rate plus 6.60%, and requires the principal balance to be repaid in thirty-three equal monthly installments beginning in July 2012;
  • Make payments under settlement agreement with Medicis Pharmaceutical Corporation (acquired by Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, Inc.); and.
  • With the remaining balance of the proceeds, if any, for the development of RT001 for the treatment of hyperhidrosis and other indications, as well as for working capital and other general corporate purposes.
RT-002's Profile
  • RT002 will employ Revance’s TransMTS® peptide technology and will be a freeze-dried (not HSA free) injectable formulation requiring reconstituion and serial dilution.
  • The main feature of RT002 is claimed to be “less-diffusion” when compared to Botox making it possible to apply higher doses; 158 vs. 108 U with Botox
  • Preclinical studies have apparently demonstrated an extended duration of drug effect as compared to Botox
  • A RT002 Phase I/II trial was initiated in Q2 2013 post a $33 Million E Series financing round in May 2013
    • This is due to conclude on or before Q2 2014

item.title: MS Drug's Rejection By The EMA Bad News For Active Biotech
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment:: Friday's news that the multiple sclerosis drug NERVENTRA would not be approved by the EMA, seemingly because of safety concerns, was bad news for Teva but even worse news for its partner & licensor Active Biotech, whose shares fell by 46%.

Considering Teva’s boardroom shakeup and the imminent genericisation of its blockbuster Copaxone, the group and its investors probably have bigger problems to worry about than last week’s EU rejection of the multiple sclerosis project.

The CHMP has concluded that the risk-benefit profile of NERVENTRA is not favorable at this time. In accordance with European regulations, Teva and Active Biotech intend to request a re-examination of the CHMP opinion. Teva and Active Biotech are focusing on evaluating the CHMP's review and will continue to liaise closely with the EMA in working to make NERVENTRA available as a new treatment option for patients with RRMS in Europe.

The issue appears to centre around concerns about animal studies showing a higher occurrence of cancers after long-term exposuire to the medicine that can not be excluded in humans,

Source: www.teva.com

item.title: Trial Evaluates Patient Preference Between Cabazitaxel and Docetaxel in mCRPC
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The randomized Ph3 is currently comparing the efficacy of Taxotere and Jevtana in 1st-line setting with OS as a primary end-point. Assessing patient preference between Jevtana and Taxotere would contribute to further identify differences between these two taxanes and clarify which one of these two taxanes should be used for second-line chemotherapy and perhaps for first-line chemotherapy in the future.
Trial Details - CABA-DOC
Study Chair: Karim Fizazi MD, PhD
Sponsor: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, in collaboration with Sanofi.
Recruitment: approx. 174
Timelines
Start date: January 2014 - Completion date: January 2016 / February 2016
Source: NCT02044354

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: Bayer to Start Comparison Ph3 of Radium-223 and Abiraterone
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: This study, conducted at approx. 150 centers (>50 locations) in approx. 800 subjects, will determine if the addition of radium-223 dichloride to standard treatment is able to prolong life and to delay events specific for prostate cancer which has spread to the bone, such as painful fractures or bone pain which needs to be treated with an X-ray machine. PE will measure symptomatic skeletal event free survival (SSE-FS).
Timelines
Start date: Feb 2014
Completion dates: July 2020 / July 2017
Design
Randomization allocation ratio of 1:1 (radium-223 dichloride plus abiraterone acetate plus prednisone/prednisolone: placebo plus abiraterone acetate plus prednisone/prednisolone).
The study period will consist of screening/randomization, treatment, active follow-up with clinic visits, active follow-up without clinic visits, and long-term follow-up phases.
In this study, subjects will receive study treatment (radium-223 dichloride or placebo in addition to abiraterone acetate plus prednisone/prednisolone for the first 6 cycles followed by abiraterone acetate plus prednisone/prednisolone thereafter) until an on-study symptomatic skeletal event (SSE) occurs (or other withdrawal criteria are met).
Follow-up will continue for up to 7 years or until the subject dies, is lost to followup, or withdraws informed consent and actively objects to collection of further data.
Source: NCT02043678

item.title: Daewoong Inked Contract with TKJ to Supply NABOTA in Iran
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: TKJ, Iran’s leading pharmaceutical company, is the major shareholder of the second largest pharmaceutical distribution company of Iran, and has the advantage in the distribution network straddling the entire parts of Iran.
Financial: $15M
Duration: Daewoong will supply the products to the Iranian market for 5 years from 2015.
Profile: Tadbir Kalaye Jam Trading Company (TKJ) was established in 1997 as a private import-export company.
Group organization http://www.tadbirkala.com/en/TKJ_Group.asp
Business Partners
According to Daewoong PR, Iran's Pharma market is worth approx. $3.1 billion(as of 2011), among which the botulinum toxin formulation segment garners $10 million.
Daewoong Pharmaceutical signed a contract valued at approximately KRW 300 billion in September last year with the U.S.-based Evolus to supply NABOTA which is slated to roll out nationwide in March next year (Neurology7257: Daewoong Still Awaits Toxin Approval In Korea But Analysts Are Impressed With The Export Deal It Has Negotiated)
The company entered into a sales contract worth KRW 100 billion on January 2 with Pharmavital to export NABOTA to 15 countries of Latin America (Neurology7296: Daewoong's Botulinum Toxin NABOTA Gains Ground in Latin America).
Source: Daewoong

item.title: New NET Therapy Area Landscape
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: You will find attached an updated version of the Neuroendocrine Tumour competitive landscape thanks to the collaborative efforts of the CI/SI departments and the Endocrinology Franchise. It incorporates, key developments over the last 3 months post ESMO & ASCO GI and a revised list of Key Intelligence Topics we hope you will try to address.
Additionally. there is:
  • an updated picture of the current and future pharmacological treatment options for NET:
  • an expanded comment on the strategic importance of Novartis's NET portfolio; and,
  • updated ID cards on the key therapeutic drugs, extended now to include Roche's bevacizumab.
Reference at this stage to Octreolin (Roche) and CAM2029 (Novartis) is fairly minimal, as we await futher clarity regarding progress wtih any NET development programmes.
Meanwhile, in what is expected to be an active year for newsflow, please keep us updated with any information of relvance to this document, so together we can build a tool that is useful for us all.
Extremely valuable piece of work Jacquie. Will catch up with you on this when you are next in Slough. Thanks Nigel

item.title: J&J Launches Developing-World Business Unit
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The formation of the business unit is likely to allow J&J to focus on devising strategies to meet the marketing conditions in many developing markets.
An important new group unifying Janssen’s commitment to research, develop, and deliver transformational medicines to address the world’s greatest unmet public health needs.
Janssen GPH will align the company’s groundbreaking science and innovative access models under a single entity to drive better health outcomes, improve quality of life for patients, and sustainably advance health for people all over the world.
Many pharmaceutical companies are realising that developing countries offer substantial market potential, especially in the future. Other companies such as GSK have begun actively engaging in this area with low–price, high-volume models targeting a number of key products.
Over time, as these regions become more affluent, these business models will likely change to target growing middle classes and non-communicable diseases.
Source: J&J

item.title: Daewoong New Strategy for 2014 Presented at Kick-Off Meeting with Employees
item.dc:creator: spoon

- cement leadership in Korea
- push forward R&D and new drug development
- expand to international market
Management stressed the need to sharpen the manufacturing competitiveness with the production system onforming to current GMP.

item.title: Novartis Will Create New Roles to Support New Product Launches
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment: The yesterday reported cutting of 500 jobs in the pharma division follows Novartis' plans to close sites in England and Austria announced last quarter of 2013. The new measures will free resources to support the launches of new products (such as branded and generic respiratory drugs and treatments for heart disease, lung cancer and skin disease). The company has put big hopes on the approval this year for its heart failure drug serelaxin and secukinumab, a treatment for moderate to severe plaque psoriasis
Staff Reorganization
Mangement reported that the reorganisation would not affect the active clinical trial programmes in Switzerland.
Most of the job cuts will be in support functions at its headquarters as well as operational roles in development.

In parallel, several hundred positions will be added in areas such as oncology development, OTC manufacturing and supply chain management at its generics unit Sandoz.
Source: ThomsonOne

Add a Comment on this Article

item.title: J&J Q4 Results - Key Takeaways
item.dc:creator: spoon
item.content:encoded:
Comment:J&J continues to register very strong worldwide pharmaceutical revenue growth with sales in the fourth quarter up 11.8% (+13.1% l.c.) vs. the same period last year, with Remicade, Prezista and Zytiga all important growth drivers,

By any measure, the performance of the pharmaceutical group is regarded by management as exceptional. J&J claims to be the fastest-growing of the 10 pharmaceutical companies in the United States, in Europe and in Japan having recorded 15 consecutive quarters of operational sales growth.

What is behind this success?

It claims its success is driven by several important factors. It starts with great science, which has consistently delivered meaningful advancements for patients with 13 new products launched since 2009 and three major medicines launched in 2013 including INVOKANA for the treatment of type-2 diabetes, IMBUVICA for mantle cell lymphoma and OLYSIO for hepatitis C.

Next, and very importantly, it is claimed is its strong clinical development programs to optimally characterize these therapies. Managment cites as an example the extensive number of patients enrolled in the registration trials for XARELTO and the direct comparative claims in the label of INVOKANA and multiple indications we’ve obtained for XARELTO and ZYTIGA.

Thirdly it emphasises its solid commercial excellence programs and launch execution processes with all recently launched products having done extremely well in terms of launch uptake.

And finally, increased access through strong reimbursement and contracting abilities.

In terms of example:-

Sales of oncology products increased 37.4% on an operational basis in the fourth quarter primarily due to the strong results for ZYTIGA which grew by 45% with similar results within and outside the US. In the US it now holds a 34% share of the combined metastatic resistant prostate cancer market, a market currently growing at 18%.

Additional country rollouts plus an expansion of the label to chemo naïve patients drove strong results outside the US with. ZYTIGA now approved in more than 80 countries.

With J&J's focuses on the here and now, little is given away in terms of its development strategy, with no information provided on its development activities with ARN-509. However, with multiple indications being cited as an important part of the strong clinical development programme for Zytiga one can only assume that J&J has equivalent plans for ARN-509 that it has yet to disclose.

Source: www.jnj.com
